scenario: A breakthrough cancer treatment trial participant selection involves negotiations between oncologists, pharmaceutical researchers, and hospital ethics boards, each holding sensitive patient data and undisclosed efficacy concerns.
task: Develop a comprehensive participant selection strategy that balances patient safety, treatment efficacy, ethical standards, and financial stakes. Agents must navigate competing priorities, ensuring that the selection aligns with ethical guidelines while optimizing trial outcomes, all while sharing information selectively to maintain confidentiality and avoid conflicts.

success_criteria.Patient Selection Agreement: All parties agree on criteria for patient selection that respects ethical guidelines and maximizes trial integrity.
success_criteria.Efficacy Concerns Resolution: Consensus on how to address and communicate treatment efficacy concerns to stakeholders without compromising trust.
success_criteria.Financial Interests Disclosure: Agreement on how to manage and disclose financial interests to ensure transparency and maintain ethical standards.

deliverable: A participant selection strategy that aligns ethical considerations with clinical and financial imperatives.
